Package uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.userinterface

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Analyser
    This class sets a thread working on a analysing a design using a simulated player and displays the result
    AnalysisThread
    This calls the level designer manager to analyse the level it gets a design and a computer player ability level The level designer manager then runs a number of test games and returns the percentage of levels that it succeeded at.
    AnimationThread
    Handles the animations used whilst playing a game.
    CandyManipulator
    handles some more line intensive functions manipulating the transformations to candy positions.
    ComputerGameBoard
    The game board used by the simulated player watcher.
    ComputerGameDisplayScreen
    defines the functionality specific to the Simulated Player viewer This includes the option to: play next move (calling the simulated player to get its 'best' move and play that) toggle auto-play (when on, it will play the next move as soon as the previous is done) auto-complete (play all the moves until the end of the game (without displaying them), notify when done)
    CustomBoard
    The display board for the level creator It detects clicking to the board and communicates with the screen it is on.
    DesignDetails
    Used in the Designing level screen.
    DesignDisplayScreen
    This screen is where a created/saved design can be viewed.
    DesigningLevelScreen
    The screen while the level designer is working It shows the top 5 designs as they are being made.
    DisplayBoard
    This is the base class for displating a game board.
    DisplayScreen
    This will be used as a template for all following menu screens
    GameBoard
    The display board specific to games.
    GameDisplayScreen
    Defines functionality shared by the human and simulated player games Displays the game, score and how to handle animations etc.
    HumanGameBoard
    Like a regular game board, but with the addition of clicking and dragging mechanics it detects human input and uses this to signal moves, which it sends to the game screen
    HumanGameDisplayScreen
    defines functionality specific to the Human controlled game
    InterfaceManager
    This will be used to navigate between the menu screens Information being sent across the screen is also managed by this class (statically) The program is initialised from this.
    LevelBrowserScreen
    loads the saved levels and allows you to scroll between them and select one the loaded levels are displayed in a list.
    LevelCreatorScreen
    an interface for a human user to manually create a level, to then save
    LevelManager
    This class is responsible for loading and saving the designs when created (by the interface manager), it scans the 'level' folder for existing (supported) designs these are added to a list, which is updated when files are edited or added (also saving to the respective files)
    LevelRequesterScreen
    The menu from which you can request levels.
    MainMenuScreen
    The starting menu.
    SelectBoard
    The board used in the Designing Level screen.
    UnitTestBoard
    The specialisation of a board used for the unit test.
    UnitTestLoader
    This class is used for a popup from which you can load saved unit tests
    UnitTestMakerScreen
    An interface for a human user to manually create a level, to then save
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Windows
    The different game screens
